intro: Erigeron cymosus, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron cymosus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
